nl.weeaboo.vn.scene

Interface IDrawable

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IColorizable, IDestructible, IDrawTransform, IInputHandler, IPositionable, ISignalHandler, IVisualElement, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IButton, IGridPanel, IImageDrawable, IPanel, ITextDrawable, ITransformable

    public interface IDrawable
extends IVisualElement, IColorizable, IDrawTransform, IPositionable

    • Method Detail

      • getLayer

        @Nullable
ILayer getLayer()
        Returns:
        The parent layer that contains this drawable, or null if not attached to any layer.

      • getBlendMode

        BlendMode getBlendMode()
        Description copied from interface: IDrawTransform
        Determines how to blend with previously rendered pixels.
        Specified by:
        getBlendMode in interface IDrawTransform

      • isClipEnabled

        boolean isClipEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: IDrawTransform
        Enables/disables clipping. If false, rendering may occur outside of the paren't bounds.
        Specified by:
        isClipEnabled in interface IDrawTransform

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible(double minAlpha)
        A utility method to check if visible && getAlpha() >= minAlpha.
        Parameters:
        minAlpha - The minimum alpha to consider 'visible'.
        Returns:
        true if this drawable is visible and at least matches the minimum alpha.

      • contains

        boolean contains(double cx,
                 double cy)
        Checks if the specified X/Y point lies 'inside' this renderable. What's considered inside may be different depending on the type of renderable.
        Parameters:
        cx - The X-coordinate of the point to test.
        cy - The Y-coordinate of the point to test.
        Returns:
        true if the point is contained within this renderable.

      • getX

        double getX()
        X-coordinate of the drawable. How this corresponds to the final visual bounds depends on the type of drawable.

      • getY

        double getY()
        Y-coordinate of the drawable. How this corresponds to the final visual bounds depends on the type of drawable.
